poem:
**Turbulence**

In the belly of sky's sway,
cabin pitched, hearts caught in storm's snare,
metal bird forced to nest in Memphis—
seven souls marked by wind's invisible claw,
a dance of air,
faceless peril woven
through the clouds' fabric.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Severe turbulence injures seven people on United Airlines flight from Cancun Severe turbulence caused injuries to seven people on a United Airlines flight from Cancun in Mexico to Chicago and forced an emergency landing in Memphis, according to the airline. The Boeing 737 was hit by the rough weather and forced to land on Wednesday in the latest such incident to hit the industry. One person was taken to hospital. “United flight 1196 diverted to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
